news.title: Core inflation rate held at 2.9% in August, as expected, Fed’s gauge shows
news.summary: The personal consumption expenditures price index for August was expected to increase 2.9% from a year ago. The Personal Consumption Expenditure Price Index is a measure of inflation in the U.S.

news.title: Shares of Paccar - Peterbilt and Kenworth owner - soar after Trump's heavy truck tariffs
news.summary: Paccar's competitors can manufacture trucks cheaper in Mexico, analysts say. Trump's tariffs likely level the playing field, according to analysts.

news.title: Accenture plans on 'exiting' staff who can't be reskilled on AI amid restructuring strategy
news.summary: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet said as advanced AI becomes core to the company's strategy, employees are expected to "retrain and retool" at scale.

news.title: U.S. to impose 100% tariff on branded, patented drugs unless firms build plants locally, Trump says
news.summary: The measure will not apply to companies building drug manufacturing plants in the U.S., Trump said. The measure will also not apply for companies building medical devices in the United States.

news.title: China stays conspicuously quiet after Trump’s TikTok deal declaration
news.summary: U.S. President Donald Trump says that he’s received Beijing's nod on a deal that would see TikTok stay alive in the United States.

news.title: Consumer spending is strong — and the U.S. economy is all right
news.summary: High tariffs, lingering inflation and more trouble finding a job apparently haven't been enough to throw consumers into funk. Americans increased spending again in August to help keep the U.S. economy chugging.

news.title: Are markets getting wary on AI spending? Here’s what billionaire hedge fund founder David Einhorn thinks.
news.summary: More investors are starting to question the trillion dollar pledges to build AI infrastructure. More investors are Starting to Question the Trillion Dollar pledges to Build AI Infrastructure.

news.title: Inflation rises again, PCE shows, but not enough to alarm the Fed
news.summary: Prices aren’t rising so fast as to postpone rate cuts, says the Bank of Canada. The central bank has cut interest rates to a record low of 1.5 per cent.

news.title: I’m 70 and have Alzheimer’s. My son’s girlfriend put $750 worth of lottery tickets on a credit card I gave him. What can I do?
news.summary: “I contacted the credit-card company, but was advised they could not reimburse me for the theft,” she said. “I was advised that they could no longer reimburse me.”

news.title: Fed’s Barkin upbeat on U.S. economic outlook despite rising inflation, slower job growth
news.summary: “The consumer is frankly exhausted,” Tom Barkin said Friday. “The consumers are frankly exhausted.” “It’s time for a change,’’ Barkin added.
